abstracts.cdata!:
The Fifth Industrial Credit Project
            (Industrial Credit V) for India was approved by the IBRD on
            June 5, 1963 and made effective on September 17, 1963. This
            project was similar to four earlier loans to the Industrial
            Credit and Investment Corporation of India Ltd. (ICICI). The
            major issue discussed during the preparation, appraisal, and
            negotiations of the project was whether to increase the
            limit of projects that ICICI could approve without prior
            Bank approval. The previous four loans had not been closed
            when the Fifth was approved. Due to rapid commitments, a
            Sixth loan to ICICI was approved in 1965. The loan closing
            date was extended once up to December 31, 1967, due to
            approved firms having problems obtaining import licenses.
            The Bank refused a second extension, but suggested that the
            balances of various unfinished sub-projects be transferred
            to the Sixth loan. This transfer was accomplished
            successfully. A report on the Sixth loan to ICICI has
            commended the institution on its satisfactory progress in
            appraisal of subloans, market analyses, and management. This
            report notes that the subsequent Sixth, Seventh, and Eighth
            loans to ICICI have been rated as satisfactory by another
            report (Report Number 949) dated December 17, 1975.

repnme.cdata!:
India - Fifth Industrial Credit and
            Investment Corporation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fifth Industrial Credit and
            Investment Corporation (ICICI) Project in India will finance
            a loan to replenish its foreign exchange resources. This
            project will encourage local and foreign private capital
            participation, and assist in the expansion of the Indian
            capital market. It will consist of two rupee loans from the
            Government of India. This project will assist in the
            development of private industry, and encourage local and
            foreign private capital participation.

India - Fifth Industrial Credit and
            Investment Corporation Project

            and Investment Corporation Project
